sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: The only configuration needed for OpenLDAP is to run ldconfig. The LDAP server can be started by /usr/sbin/slapd as described in the man page slapd(8).
To utilize GDBM as the database backend, the "database" entry in /etc/slapd.conf must be changed from "bdb" to "ldbm". You can use both by creating an additional database section in /etc/slapd.conf.
Significant configuration is needed for OpenLDAP to utilized security features. The OpenLDAP 2.1 Administrator's Guide is a good place to start.
Data can be added to the LDAP database via ldapadd. There are other programs that can use the database. For more information see the appropriate man page.
